data.title: Cryengine C# API is not complete,it is too little for feature and Gameobject can controlled via C#.#1
data.body: I compared  Cryengine C# API with C++ API, I found from class list that class is too little by C# API provided.such as no classes for can controlling AI animation and controlling AI behavior ,controlling AI movement, controlling material ,controlling shader, controlling render ,controlling VR ,controlling lighting ,controlling physics interaction, controlling particle effect, controlling audio interaction,etc.... in a word,Cryengine C# API is not complete.this will result in C# user can not make full use of C#'s advantages to develop complete game or VR project with Cryengine Engine.strongly suggest Cryengine Engine can early fully support C# and Mono just like unity3d.

data.title: Problem locating assets, and other errors, attempting to run on Debian Jessie
data.body:
This is progress, as I could not compile it the last time I tried a month or so ago.

after executing `./bin/linux_x64_gcc/GameLauncher` I get the following log

data.title: Qt Sandbox pop up window mis-focus when closing
data.body: When trying to close Qt Sandbox when it is maximized and not in focus by right clicking the task bar and choosing close, a second window can be created presenting a save level dialogue.  Clicking this new window in the task bar does not give it focus.  To view this dialogue you must click on the main Sandbox window in the task bar.

data.title: Extend DRS SpeakLine to use Context Variable
data.body:
Extended the DRS SpeakLine action to allow setting the line to speak using a context variable.

Example Use Case:
A game has a radio which, when switched on, will play an audio clip. There may be a couple of these radios in the game each with a different clip. The radio component can store a string which can now be passed along as a context variable, and the SpeakLine action will directly play that dialog database line.

Note: The validation of the line existing in the dialog database will not be able to verify due to lack of ability to access a valid DRS::IResponseInstance - which is needed to determine the real LineId to play.

data.title: VS2017 support
data.body:
Hi,
We (the Microsoft VC++ team) do a nightly build of a number of open source projects as part of our testing.  This includes CryEngine. We ran into an issue after we bumped the compiler version (_MSC_VER) from 1900 (VS2015) to 1910 (VS2017).

There are two checks in the code base which test against == 1900 and they will now fail.

Here is a patch we use locally:

[cryengine_cmake.zip](https://github.com/CRYTEK-CRYENGINE/CRYENGINE/files/781915/cryengine_cmake.zip)

Can you make the change to support VS2017? Thanks!

Xiang Fan
Microsoft Visual C++ Dev

data.title: CharacterAnimationPicker doesn't work
data.body:
CharacterAnimationPicker in Resources.h does not work. I tried it with the GeomEntity in the Editor and nothing happens when you click the folder icon to select an animation for your character. 

It would be incredibly helpful when selecting animations for a GeomEntity or any custom entity. Currently, you have to go to the Character Tool to find your character, find its animations, copy the animation name and then paste it into the Animation property of the GeomEntity. 

Here is the code I used for the property:

**`archive(Serialization::CharacterAnimationPicker(m_animation), "Animation", "Animation");`**

data.title: !FE (PluginManager) (uniflare) Allow loading cryplugin.csv from game …
data.body:
…directory to fix release builds.

New Feature:
cryplugin.csv is now searched for in this order:
%PROJECT_FOLDER%/cryplugin.csv (NOT in release builds)
%ANY_LOADED_PAK_FILE%/cryplugin.csv (Any build mode)

data.title: Problems building Release on Linux
data.body:
Hello,

So I'm trying to build this on Linux, but when I launch the building with:

`./cry_waf.sh build_linux_x64_clang_profile --project-spec=gamesdk`

After some output, there's a building error with the curses.h library:

```
CRYENGINE/Code/SDKs/ncurses/include/ncursesw/ncurses.h:1:1: error: unknown type name 'curses'
curses.h
^
Code/SDKs/ncurses/include/ncursesw/ncurses.h:1:7: error: cannot use dot operator on a type
curses.h
```
So I went to the ncurses.h file and, yeah, it only contained a 'curses.h' in its first line. That was strange so I retried the download of the SDKs using the python script and it was empty again. Going to the code, I could see that the downloaded tar was hosted on:

https://github.com/CRYTEK-CRYENGINE/CRYENGINE/releases/download/5.3.0/CRYENGINE_v5.3.0_SDKs.tar.gz

Which is the 5.3.0 version, for the 5.3.1 is in:

https://github.com/CRYTEK-CRYENGINE/CRYENGINE/releases/download/5.3.1/CRYENGINE_v5.3.1_SDKs.tar.gz

Well, both ncurses.h are "empty".

Going to the releases page: https://github.com/CRYTEK-CRYENGINE/CRYENGINE/releases/ I found the SDKs also in .zip, and there it is, the ncurses.h file is a perfect symlink to curses.h there (5.3.0). Could that be fixed in the .tar.gz for the linux users?

After fixing? that, I got the following error:

```
/usr/bin/ld:/home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/Code/SDKs/SDL2/lib/linux_x64/libSDL2.so: file format not recognized; treating as linker script
/usr/bin/ld:/home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/Code/SDKs/SDL2/lib/linux_x64/libSDL2.so:2: syntax error
clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
Build failed
 -> task in 'cxxprogram (linux_x64_clang|profile)' failed (exit status 1): 
	{task 140126550614224: cxxprogram Main.cpp.1043.o,Assert.cpp.1043.o,EngineSymbols.cpp.1043.o -> GameLauncher}
'clang++-3.8 -o /home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/BinTemp/linux_x64_clang_profile/_shared/Code/Launcher/LinuxLauncher/GameLauncher -Wl,--rpath=$ORIGIN /home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/BinTemp/linux_x64_clang_profile/_shared/Code/Launcher/LinuxLauncher/Main.cpp.1043.o /home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/BinTemp/linux_x64_clang_profile/_shared/Code/Launcher/LinuxLauncher/Assert.cpp.1043.o /home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/BinTemp/linux_x64_clang_profile/_shared/Code/Launcher/LinuxLauncher/EngineSymbols.cpp.1043.o -L/home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/Code -L/home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/Code/SDKs/SDL2/lib/linux_x64 -L/home/iruiz/development/Gaming/CRYENGINE/Code/SDKs/ncurses/lib -lpthread -ldl -lSDL2 -lncursesw -lmenuw -lformw'
```

Which I also fixed by replacing the SDL lib with the one of the 5.3.0 zip package.

Am I doing something wrong or is the package bad formed?

Best,
Ignacio
